Service Details: - Assists individuals through education and clinical support to manage their diabetes and reduce risk of complications- Programs include:  Getting Started Classes, individual assessments, Staying on Track, Refresher Class, Pre-Diabetes Class, Gestational Diabetes one-to-one counselling and classes- Offers specific information sessions, such as weight loss, carbohydrate counting, meal planning, label reading, cholesterol, diabetes medications with pharmacist, and insulin pumps- Registration is required for all information sessions- Also offers Pediatric Clinic education program for children and youth from birth to 18 years of age and their parents
Hours: Community Health & Services Centre, 505 Doyle AveAppointments available:  Mon-Fri, 9am - 3pm Drop-in session with a Nurse or Dietitian:  Fri, 2pm - 3:30pm * Tue, 1pm - 8:30pmMay Bennett Wellness Centre, 135 Davie RdAppointments available:  Thu and Fri, 8:30am - 4pmDrop-in session with a Nurse or Dietitian:  Thu, 2:30pm - 3:30pmWest Kelowna Health Unit, 160-2300 Carrington RdAppointments available:  Mon and Wed, 9am - 3pmDrop-in session with a Nurse or Dietitian:  Wed, 11:30am - 12pm
Eligibility: Individuals diagnosed with either Type 1, Type 2, Gestational, or Pre-Diabetes elevated blood sugar levels
Address & Map: Kelowna Diabetes Clinic505 Doyle AveKelowna, BC     V1Y 0C5View MapQuest Map
